translated: Elder’s Birth Stories🔽. The Chapter with Tinda-giver
The Elder Girinelapūjaka’s Story
“Formerly I was a hunter,
wandering in the forest;
I saw the dust-free Buddha,
who had gone beyond all things.
In him, the one of great compassion,
who delights in the welfare of all beings,

analyzed: pasanna cittaḥ sumanaḥ  na ilapuppham apūjayi
translated: with a confident mind and a happy mind🔽I worshipped with a blue lotus.
Thirty-one aeons ago,
the flower I worshipped with;
I do not know of a bad destination,
this is the fruit of worshipping the Buddha.
My defilements have been burnt up,
I live without defilements.
Welcome indeed it was for me,
I have done the Buddha’s bidding.
The four analytical insights,
I have done the Buddha’s bidding.”🔽Thus the venerable Girinelapūjaka recited these verses.🔽The Elder Girinelapūjaka’s Story is finished.

original: Itthaṁ sudaṁ āyasmā girinelapūjako thero imā gāthāyo abhāsitthāti.🔽Girinelapūjakattherassāpadānaṁ sattamaṁ.
analyzed: ittham sudam āyasmā girinelapūjakaḥ theraḥ imāḥ gāthāyaḥ abhāsittha ati 🔽girinela pūjaka therassa apadānam sattama
translated: Thus has the venerable Elder Girinelapūjaka recited these verses.🔽The Seventh Portion🔽The Story of the Elder Girinelapūjaka
